Package com.unitedbankingservices.coin

Class CoinStorageUnit

java.lang.Object
com.unitedbankingservices.AbstractDevice<CoinStorageUnitObserver>
com.unitedbankingservices.coin.CoinStorageUnit
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDevice<CoinStorageUnitObserver>, Sink<Coin>
public class CoinStorageUnit extends AbstractDevice<CoinStorageUnitObserver> implements Sink<Coin>
Represents devices that store coins. They only receive coins, not dispense them. To access the coins inside, a human operator needs to physically remove the coins, simulated with the unload() method. A load(Coin...) method is provided for symmetry.

  • Constructor Details

    • CoinStorageUnit

      public CoinStorageUnit(int capacity)
      Creates a coin storage unit that can hold the indicated number of coins.
      Parameters:
      capacity - The maximum number of coins that the unit can hold.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If the capacity is not positive.

  • Method Details

    • getCapacity

      public int getCapacity()
      Gets the maximum number of coins that this storage unit can hold. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      The capacity.

    • getCoinCount

      public int getCoinCount()
      Gets the current count of coins contained in this storage unit. Requires power.
      Returns:
      The current count.

    • load

      public void load(Coin... coins) throws SimulationException, TooMuchCashException
      Allows a set of coins to be loaded into the storage unit directly. Existing coins in the dispenser are not removed. Announces "coinsLoaded" event. Disabling has no effect on loading/unloading. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      coins - A sequence of coins to be added. Each cannot be null.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - if the number of coins to be loaded exceeds the capacity of the unit.
      SimulationException - If coins is null.
      SimulationException - If any coin is null.
      TooMuchCashException - If too many coins are loaded.

    • unload

      public List<Coin> unload()
      Unloads coins from the storage unit directly. Announces "coinsUnloaded" event. Requires power.
      Returns:
      A list of the coins unloaded. May be empty. Will never be null.

    • receive

      public void receive(Coin coin) throws DisabledException, TooMuchCashException
      Causes the indicated coin to be added to the storage unit. If successful, announces "coinAdded" event. If a successful coin addition instead causes the unit to become full, announces "coinsFull" event. Requires power.
      Specified by:
      receive in interface Sink<Coin>
      Parameters:
      coin - The coin to add to this unit.
      Throws:
      DisabledException - If the unit is currently disabled.
      SimulationException - If coin is null.
      TooMuchCashException - If the unit is already full.

    • hasSpace

      public boolean hasSpace()
      Description copied from interface: Sink
      Returns whether the sink has space for at least one more item of cash. Requires power.
      Specified by:
      hasSpace in interface Sink<Coin>
      Returns:
      true if the sink can accept an item of cash; false otherwise.
